body.name: Playskool Step Start Walk 'n Ride Active 2-in-1 Ride-On and Walker Toy for Toddlers and Babies 9 Months and Up (Amazon Exclusive)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 21 hrs 30 mins
features: GET THOSE LITTLE LEGS MOVING: This Playskool ride-on toy for 9 months and up is a great way to engage kids in active play that will have them pushing, cruising, and scooting all the way to naptime
WALK OR RIDE, IT'S HOW YOU ROLL: Easily convert this 2-in-1 toddler and baby toy between baby walker mode and ride-on mode based on your little one's development
BUSY HANDS-ON ACTIVITIES: Bring extra hands-on fun with the knob, lever, roller, and spinner, giving kids even more ways to play with this baby and toddler toy
GIVE A FUN BABY GIFT: From backyard joyrides to hallway cruising, the Step Start Walk 'n Ride makes a great gift for 9-12 month olds to get the zoomies out of their systems
EASY-PEASY FRUSTRATION-FREE SHIPPING: Ships in simple recyclable packaging that’s easy to open and frustration free, so little ones can get to the play right away
body.description: And so it begins - baby's first steps! You’re surely proud, and maybe even a little nervous? It's ok! Help your little one revel in their newfound mobility with this 2-in-1 Playskool ride-on and walker toy for toddlers and babies 9 months and up. It's a prime toy to help keep those little legs active, and hands-on activities like knobs and spinners can help keep their minds busy, too. Easily convert it from baby walker mode to ride-on toy mode based on how your little one likes to roll. With the Playskool quality families have known and trusted for decades, there's also a built-in lock mechanism to keep the toy from converting while kids play. The Step Start Walk 'n Ride makes a great gift for toddlers and babies who love to go, go, go! Playskool and all related properties are trademarks of Hasbro.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I liked the product. But the driver can't read instructions. It says to deliver on back porch , not rotted front porch. I don't want the porch pirates stealing my stuff.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Had this for all my kids, walker and ride on toy. All my kids loved it. And easy to use. Will continue to buy for friends and families kids <3

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent. But honestly its not the greatest quality nor is it sturdy
reviews.reviewText: Like i said in my title this toy is decent. Its not awful nor is it anything amazing. One thing I dislike about this toy is that it is very un sturdy. My son is about 8.5 months old he can pull himself up onto toys, the couch ect. Hes started to walk when holding onto tables and such so i figured I would buy him a toy to help him walk better. I walked at 8 months so I figured why not. This toy is a cheap plastic and isn't very sturdy the wheels are a very light hollow plastic. The toy isn't heavy in the least bit so if your child tries pulling them self up on it when it is in walker mode I will put money on it that this toy will fall over onto them because I have seen this happen multiple times. Now when it is in sitting mode that is another story. This toy is actually very nice to ride my niece rides it and shes almost three and it works for her when shes trying to show my son what to do. All in all.... i guess if your looking for a toy that can be changed from a sit and ride to a stand and ride this is an ok toy. But DO NOT expect this toy to be amazing. you will be disappointed. If your are simply looking for a toy they can stand and walk on. Pick another toy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Put the gas cap on first. Your hand can just about fit once the handle is attached.
reviews.reviewText: Put gas cap on first. Your hand can just about fit once the handle is attached. Also to the person whose wheels don’t roll ..they have to be really pushed on. ..had the same problem But this little walker is great!

reviews.reviewText: My Child loves to push and ride this toy

reviews.reviewText: Grandson is using this to learn how to walk and enjoys using it. He also enjoys sitting on it and playing with the accessories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Wheels not rolling
reviews.reviewText: Plastic quality is good but wheels are not rolling on wooden floor , moving a little on carpet and just sliding on wooden floor, will not help little one in walking, ride on feature is also small for my 9 m old son

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great walker/ride on toy for a baby learning to stand and get around
reviews.reviewText: Great first stand/walk/ride helper, like that it is adaptable for use multiple ways.

My grandson hasn't quite grasped the concept of how to ride it, but he is using it to help him learn to walk. There are lots of little activity areas to keep him busy. Just be careful when changing it from a ride-on to a walker, as little fingers could get pinched.

Me encanto y a mi bebe wooow le fascino, con decir que hasta a mi hijo de 4 años le encanta jugar con el, es resistente y se convierte en un dos por tres de caminador a carro montable, sin duda le hemos sacado mucho provecho y siento será un artículo que nos funcionará por vario tiempo. Lo recomiendo muchísimo.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: very sturdy and good value for money
reviews.reviewText: bought 2 for twin 14month old grandsons and they both love them .. easily put together and love the fact they convert from sit ons to walkers at the click of a button
